content:
Mercury is a really interesting planet! Here are a few fun facts for you:

- Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun, and as a result, it has the shortest orbital period of any planet in the Solar System. It takes just 88 Earth days for Mercury to complete one orbit around the Sun.
- Despite its proximity to the Sun, Mercury is not the hottest planet in the Solar System. Venus, which has a thick atmosphere that traps heat, is actually hotter.
- Because of its small size and weak gravity, Mercury has a very rugged and heavily cratered surface. It also has a number of scarps (cliffs) that are the result of the planet's crust cooling and contracting over time.
- Mercury is named after the Roman messenger god, and its symbol is a stylized version of the god's caduceus (a winged staff with two snakes intertwined around it).
- In 2011, NASA's MESSENGER spacecraft became the first spacecraft to orbit Mercury, and it spent four years collecting data about the planet's geology, atmosphere, and other features.
